questions.question_text_1: What is the role of the Gaussian blur in the Canny edge detection algorithm, and how does the choice of the standard deviation parameter affect the performance of edge detection? Which option do you think best describes the role of the Gaussian blur and its relationship with the standard deviation parameter in the Canny edge detection algorithm?
question_texts: What is the role of the Gaussian blur in the Canny edge detection algorithm, and how does the choice of the standard deviation parameter affect the performance of edge detection? Which option do you think best describes the role of the Gaussian blur and its relationship with the standard deviation parameter in the Canny edge detection algorithm?

options.option_text: The Gaussian blur helps to reduce noise in the image and smooth out pixelintensity variations.The standard deviation parameter controls the amount of blurring applied, with higher values resulting in more aggressive smoothing, which may lead to loss of edge detail.

The Gaussian blur enhances edge contrast in the image and amplifies pixelintensity gradients. The standard deviation parameter determines the width of the blur kernel, with larger values resulting in sharper edges and finer details preserved.

The Gaussian blur serves to highlight high-frequency components in theimage and accentuate edge boundaries. The standard deviation parameter dictates the level of detail preserved, with smaller values preserving finer details but potentially amplifying noise.

The Gaussian blur functions to dilate edge regions in the image and expandthe edge boundaries.The standard deviation parameter controls the extent of dilation, with higher values resulting in broader edge regions but also increasing the risk of false edge detections.

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following statements and choose the correct option:  (i) Grad-CAM overcame the problems of previous works to work better in images with occlusion and multiple instances of objects.  (ii) Grad-CAM ++ uses a weighted average of pixels to solve the problem of activation maps with lesser spatial footprint getting suppressed.
question_texts: Consider the following statements and choose the correct option:  (i) Grad-CAM overcame the problems of previous works to work better in images with occlusion and multiple instances of objects.  (ii) Grad-CAM ++ uses a weighted average of pixels to solve the problem of activation maps with lesser spatial footprint getting suppressed.

options.option_text: None of the statements is True

questions.question_text_1: Which one of the following statements regarding hyperparameter tuning is True?
question_texts: Which one of the following statements regarding hyperparameter tuning is True?

options.option_text: Test set performance, with hyperparameters tuned on the validation set,would be a realistic measure of how the model will generalize to new data.
Train set is the best choice for tuning hyperparameters
Picking hyperparameters that perform the best on the validation set leads tooverfitting
Tuning hyperparameters on the test set is an acceptable approach to find themost powerful model for generalization performance

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is the correct sequence of steps of the SIFT algorithm?  1. Using the Taylor series expansion of the scale-space function, localize the key points. 2. Estimate the orientation of keypoints using the local image gradients. 3. Find the edge points using the eigenvalues of the Hessian and reject these points. 4. Find a raw SIFT descriptor vector using the gradient orientations of the neighborhood around the key points. 5. Detect extreme points in scale space using an approximation of the Laplacian of Gaussian.
question_texts: Which of the following is the correct sequence of steps of the SIFT algorithm?  1. Using the Taylor series expansion of the scale-space function, localize the key points. 2. Estimate the orientation of keypoints using the local image gradients. 3. Find the edge points using the eigenvalues of the Hessian and reject these points. 4. Find a raw SIFT descriptor vector using the gradient orientations of the neighborhood around the key points. 5. Detect extreme points in scale space using an approximation of the Laplacian of Gaussian.

An image captioning network cannot be trained end-to-end even though weare using 2 different modalities to train the network

questions.question_text_1: Consider a Faster R-CNN object detection framework, which is being trained with a minibatch size of 2. The RPN produces 512 proposals, out of which 5 and 8 of them are foreground proposals, corresponding to each image in the mini-batch. For a single mini-batch update, the bounding box regression loss will be computed ______________________ times.
question_texts: Consider a Faster R-CNN object detection framework, which is being trained with a minibatch size of 2. The RPN produces 512 proposals, out of which 5 and 8 of them are foreground proposals, corresponding to each image in the mini-batch. For a single mini-batch update, the bounding box regression loss will be computed ______________________ times.

questions.question_text_1: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are widely used to generate new images. Many GAN-based architectures have been developed over the years to improve the quality of generation.Progressive GAN, a popular architecture among many others, uses a technique called progressive growing. Which one of the options below is the purpose for progressive growing?
question_texts: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are widely used to generate new images. Many GAN-based architectures have been developed over the years to improve the quality of generation.Progressive GAN, a popular architecture among many others, uses a technique called progressive growing. Which one of the options below is the purpose for progressive growing?

options.option_text: To grow the range of loss function
To gradually train the generator by increasing the resolution of images beinggenerated in iterations
To iteratively train the generator to create 3D images from 2D ones
To shrink the size of the generator model so generator become faster
